II. Purpose of Addendum
The agency, Spaulding for Children is requesting independent living placements be
added to their license.
III. Methodology
12/7/2010 – The agency submitted an application.
12/7/2010 – The agency submitted their policy and procedures and program
statement for independent living services.
12/29/2010 – Licensing Consultant reviewed program statement, position description
and operational standards.
1/19/2011 – Licensing Consultant received an email from the Vice President of the
agency regarding the status of the agency policies and procedures regarding
independent living being added to their license.
1/20/2011 – Licensing Consultant responded to the Vice President. Policies and
procedures had been reviewed.
1/21/2011 – Licensing Consultant spoke with the Vice President regarding more
information pertaining to the location of the program.
2/24/2011 – Licensing Consultant spoke with the President regarding description of
the facility.
IV. Description of Findings and Conclusions
The agency, Spaulding for Children is located at 16250 Northland Drive in
Southfield, Michigan. It is located in the Crossroad building owned by Chuck
Lechner. The building has three stories that are located on the border of Oakland
and Wayne county. It is in close proximity to all major freeways. The building is
surrounded by lights and security parking; it is handicap accessible and ADA
compliance. Spaulding for Children occupies 19,052 square feet of office space
located on the first floor within two large suites. This building has many suites within
that include another major CPA agency, doctors and other office attendants. The
premises are clean and no safety concerns were noted. The suites that are
occupied by Spaulding have many staff offices, cubicles, storage space, as well as
visiting rooms and bathrooms.
Spaulding For Children guiding principles for the program include:
• Youth must develop and maintain positive and meaningful relationships
with adults and youth that foster belonging and connectedness;
• Youth must be actively engaged in developing life skills through setting
realistic goals, making decisions and taking responsibility,
acknowledging skills and challenges, and have “real world” experiences;
2

• Youth must be empowered by participating in decision-making,
planning, program implementation, and other youth development
opportunities;
• Youth must live in environments that are safe and promote emotional
and physical well-being;
• Youth must be connected to caring adults and community resources.
The program will provide a placement alternative for eligible youth between the ages
of 16 and 20 who display physically, emotionally, and intellectually capable of being
successful in an independent living placement. The living arrangement for the
Independent living youth may be a single apartment, a shared apartment or home, a
college dormitory, a rented room in an approved provider home with an approved
provider.
Spaulding For Children case managers will oversee this program along with their
supervisor. All BCAL Licensing Rules for Child Placing Agencies Independent Living
Programs will be followed.
V. Recommendation
I recommend that Spaulding For Children include independent living placements on
their application under terms and information.
